Package library

Interface AppConnector<MessageType,​StateType>

Type Parameters:
MessageType - this is the type that will be exchanged as a message between nodes
All Known Implementing Classes:
OilWell
public interface AppConnector<MessageType,​StateType>
This interface must be implemented by the application in order to use the library. It is composed of the methods that will be triggered by the library when a new event occurs.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void handleIncomingMessage​(java.lang.String senderHostname, int senderPort, MessageType o)
    This is the method for the application to handle a new incoming message from another node on the network.
    void handleNewConnection​(java.lang.String newConnectionHostname, int newConnectionPort)
    This is the method for the application to handle a new connection from another node of the network.
    void handleRemoveConnection​(java.lang.String removeConnectionHostname, int removeConnectionPort)
    This is the method for the application to handle the removal of a connection asked from a node of the network.
    void handleRestoredConnections​(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> connections)
    This is the method that the library will invoke on the user to handle the restore of the connections from a snapshot
    void handleRestoredState​(StateType state)
    This is the method that the library will invoke on the user to handle the restore of its state

  • Method Details

    • handleIncomingMessage

      void handleIncomingMessage​(java.lang.String senderHostname, int senderPort, MessageType o)
      This is the method for the application to handle a new incoming message from another node on the network.
      Parameters:
      senderHostname - the hostname of the sender
      senderPort - the port assigned to the RMI registry of the sender
      o - the message that the remote node sent

    • handleNewConnection

      void handleNewConnection​(java.lang.String newConnectionHostname, int newConnectionPort)
      This is the method for the application to handle a new connection from another node of the network. When creating a link the library establish a bi-directional communication between the two nodes, so this function is called when the other party decides to add a connection with us.
      Parameters:
      newConnectionHostname - the hostname of the node requesting the connection
      newConnectionPort - the port assigned to the RMI registry of the new connection

    • handleRemoveConnection

      void handleRemoveConnection​(java.lang.String removeConnectionHostname, int removeConnectionPort)
      This is the method for the application to handle the removal of a connection asked from a node of the network. When creating a link the library establish a bi-directional communication between the two nodes, so this function is called when the other party decides to remove the connection.
      Parameters:
      removeConnectionHostname - the hostname of the node requesting the removal of the connection
      removeConnectionPort - the port assigned to the RMI registry of the node requesting the removal of the connection

    • handleRestoredState

      void handleRestoredState​(StateType state)
      This is the method that the library will invoke on the user to handle the restore of its state
      Parameters:
      state - the restored state

    • handleRestoredConnections

      void handleRestoredConnections​(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> connections)
      This is the method that the library will invoke on the user to handle the restore of the connections from a snapshot
      Parameters:
      connections - an ArrayList of Entities of the restored connections
